name: The Matchmaking Contest
description:
It was told that Shinta/Sita met her soulmate in a contest that was made by her father, Janaka.

Trying to find the best husband for Shinta, Janaka organized a competition for all the prince and noblemen in the country with the condition that Sita would marry only that person who would be able to string the bow of the god Shiva. 

The bow was not made for an ordinary mortal. It can't be lifted by ordinary person, yet, the legend said that the bow "chooses" a benevolent person to be the one who can use it. 

Long story short, one of the contestant successfully lift the bow and fastens the string taut. The successful contestant is Rama.

Soon, Rama and Shinta become the couple that is told as "the match from heaven".

Behind the story, there are 2 lingering questions; if they were matched by a contest, does love ever involved from the beginning of their journey? Or the journey that they will go through would only started based on directions instead of truly made from heaven?
